body: Notable Women's Rights Leaders         "When Anthony Met Stanton" is a bronze statue of the May 1851 introduction of Susan B. Anthony to Elizabeth Cady Stanton by Amelia Bloomer. NPS  There were many men and women who were involved, committed, and influential to the women's rights movement who did not attend the First Women's Rights Convention. This section highlights a few of the notable women's rights leaders in history.
title: Women's Rights National Historical Park: Notable Women's Rights Leaders
